column4: Hello everyone. My ubuntu installation went just fine but whenever the system boots into GUI, the screen goes black with the backlight on and nothing on display. The same thing happened before when I tried booting Ubuntu from the LiveCD so I had to do an installation from the text-based alternative CD
Is there any way to get the GUI to work?
it is working actually, as I can even hear the startup sound - just nothing displays on the screen.
do you get a Grub menu at boot?

once at the menu, select your ubuntu entry to boot with, press 'e' to edit the line, scroll down to the line that has the  /boot/vmlinuz.....   go to the end of it, and add -> acpi=off noapic; press Ctrl-x to boot from line
Do I include the semi-colon after noapic?
that's to bypass the acpi module, which causes issues, usually a blank screen at boot
I assume you didn't press ctrl-x to boot from line?   rather than pressing enter which changes nothing and uses whatever WAS there
I did press ctrl+x and it did go through the booting sequence
but after those several lines scrolled past really fast, when it came time for the GUI to load, I got a back-lit black screen
something like a gray textured wallpaper did appear for a split second
you pressed ctrl-x right after typing in those arguments?
now we know is not that then :)
what about the 'safe mode' option?   does it work?
